selected_quotes: Anaerobic digestion characteristics and kinetics of four livestock manures with different substrate concentrations

citation.abstract: Anaerobic digestions of pig manure (PM), dairy manure (DM), chicken manure (CM) and rabbit manure (RM) at initial volatile solid loading (VSL) of 8gVS/L, 16gVS/L, 32g VS/L, 64g VS/L were investigated under mesophilic conditions. The maximum methane yields of 410, 270, 377 and 323mL CH4/gVSadded for PM, DM, CM and RM were all obtained at initial VSL of 8gVS/L, respectively. The improvement of substrate concentration to 64gVS/L not only decreased the methane yield and biodegradability both by 22.4%, 37.3%, 49.1% and 34.6% for PM, DM, CM and RM respectively, but also reduced the methane content in final biogas production. The Cone model (R(2): 0.9910-0.9974) showed a better fit to the experiment data and the calculated parameters indicated that anaerobic digestion of manures at higher loading has longer lag phase and lower hydrolysis rate.
citation.title: Comparison of anaerobic digestion characteristics and kinetics of four livestock manures with different substrate concentrations

author.name: MethaneNet
author.description: Biogeochemistry, sources, fluxes, microbiology and atmospheric aspects of CH4 in the modern and ancient Earth system. Tweets by @MikePeacock86 & @GauciGauci.
